data.title: Matteo Salvini duels with the ‘Sardines’ for the heart of small‑town Italy
data.meta_description: Matteo Salvini bounced on stage last night in the small northern town of Bibbiano to chanting and cheers from just over 1,000 fans whom he called “brave men and women”. Two hundred yards away a larger crowd had turned out on the bitterly cold evening to show how much they loathed him. On Sunday th
data.text:
Matteo Salvini bounced on stage last night in the small northern town of Bibbiano to chanting and cheers from just over 1,000 fans whom he called “brave men and women”. Two hundred yards away a larger crowd had turned out on the bitterly cold evening to show how much they loathed him.

On Sunday the leader of the hardline League party hopes to end 75 years of left-wing rule in the northern region of Emilia-Romagna.

Mr Salvini walked away from his coalition government with Five Star last year only for them to replace him with the centre-left Democratic Party, which runs Emilia-Romagna. If Mr Salvini defeats the Democrats on Sunday he believes the government in Rome will implode, paving the way for a general election
